Larissa Feng
full-time human being.

Reading List

“There are worse crimes than burning books.
One of them is not reading them.”
- Ray Bradbury

I read a lot. I read as much as I can. I read in an attempt to truly understand how the world and the beings within it work, which - given that nothing is mutually exclusive - means that I try read everything.

Current

  • The City & the City by China Miéville
  • Wired For Love: : How Understanding Your Partner’s Brain and Attachment Style Can Help You Defuse Conflict and Build a Secure Relationship by Stan Tatkin

2019

  • Growth Hacker Marketing by Ryan Holiday
  • Rework by Jason Fried & David Heinemeier Hansson
  • Everything Is Illuminated by Jonathan Safran Foer
  • Agua Viva by Clarice Lispector
  • The Phoenix Project: A Novel About IT, DevOps, and Helping Your Business Win by Gene Kim, Kevin Behr, and George Spafford
  • Kinder than Solitude by Yiyun Li
  • Between Friends by Amos Oz
  • Tell the Machine Goodnight by Katie Williams
  • How to Cure a Fanatic by Amos Oz
  • Ancillary Sword by Ann Leckie
  • Ancillary Justice by Ann Leckie
  • Transit by Rachel Cusk
  • Despair by Vladimir Nabokov
  • Outline by Rachel Cusk
  • Americanah by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

2018

  • A Higher Loyalty: Truth, Lies, and Leadership by James Comey
  • So Good They Can’t Ignore You: Why Skills Trump Passion in the Quest for Work You Love by Cal Newport
  • Crucial Conversations: Tools for Talking When Stakes Are High by Kerry Patterson, Joseph Grenny, Ron McMillan, Al Switzler, and Stephen R. Covey
  • The Responsibility of Intellectuals by Noam Chomsky
  • Bel Canto by Ann Patchett
  • Mother Night by Kurt Vonnegut
  • The Five Dysfunctions of a Team by Patrick Lencioni
  • 9-11: Was There an Alternative? by Noam Chomsky
  • The Little Buddhist Monk / The Proof by César Aira
  • Ema, the Captive by César Aira
  • Powerful: Building a Culture of Freedom and Responsibility by Patty McCord
  • Hills Like White Elephants by Ernest Hemingway
  • A Very Old Man with Enormous Wings by Gabriel García Márquez
  • When Breath Becomes Air by Paul Kalanithi
  • The Reader by Bernhard Schlink
  • Zeitoun by Dave Eggers
  • The Value of Nothing: How to Reshape Market Society and Redefine Democracy by Raj Patel
  • The End of Growth by Jeff Rubin
  • Nickel and Dimed: On (Not) Getting By In America by Barbara Ehrenreich
  • Disgrace by J.M. Coetzee
  • All the Light We Cannot See by Anthony Doerr
  • An Artist of the Floating World by Kazuo Ishiguro
  • The Buried Giant by Kazuo Ishiguro
  • A Short History of Southeast Asia by Peter Church
  • Call Me By Your Name by André Aciman
  • The Underground Railroad by Colson Whitehead
  • Marcovaldo by Italo Calvino
  • A Superior Man by Paul Yee
  • If on a Winter’s Night a Traveler by Italo Calvino
  • The Martian by Andy Weir
  • Homegoing by Yaa Gyasi
  • Mother Night by Kurt Vonnegut
  • A Visit from the Goon Squad by Jennifer Egan

2017

  • Shantytown by César Aira
  • The Girl with All the Gifts by M.R. Carey
  • Armageddon in Retrospect by Kurt Vonnegut
  • Doing Good Better: How Effective Altruism Can Help Make You Make a Difference by William MacAskill
  • Release It! Design and Deploy Production-Ready Software by Michael T. Nygard
  • Wenjack by Joseph Boyden
  • Alcatraz From Inside: The Hard Years, 1942-1952 by Jim Quillen
  • Assignment Alcatraz by Patrick Mahoney
  • What We Talk About When We Talk About Love by Raymond Carver
  • Mastery: The Keys to Success and Long-Term Fulfillment by George Leonard
  • The Sirens of Titan by Kurt Vonnegut
  • Slaughterhouse-Five by Kurt Vonnegut
